|coordinates_display = inline,title |coordinates_type = region:US_type:city |latd = 40 |latm = 17 |lats = 40 |latNS = N |longd = 78 |longm = 52 |longs = 26 |longEW = W |elevation_footnotes = |elevation_m = |elevation_ft = 1834 |postal_code_type = [[Zip code]] |postal_code = |area_code = [[Area code 814|814]] |website = |footnotes = }} '''Geistown''' is a borough in [[Cambria County, Pennsylvania|Cambria County]], [[Pennsylvania]], [[United States]]. It is part of the [[Johnstown, Pennsylvania]] [[Metropolitan Statistical Area]]. The population was 2,555 at the 2000 census. ==Geography== Geistown is located at {{coord|40|17|40|N|78|52|26|W|type:city}} (40.294325, -78.873968){{GR|1}}. According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the borough has a total area of {{convert|1.1|sqmi|km2}}, all of it land. ==Demographics== As of the [[census]]{{GR|2}} of 2000, there were 2,555 people, 1,105 households, and 749 families residing in the borough. The [[population density]] was 2,364.1 people per square mile (913.4/km²). There were 1,160 housing units at an average density of 1,073.3 per square mile (414.7/km²). The racial makeup of the borough was 97.69% [[White (U.S. Census)|White]], 0.39% [[African American (U.S. Census)|African American]], 0.04% [[Native American (U.S. Census)|Native American]], 1.37% [[Asian (U.S. Census)|Asian]], 0.04% from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 0.47% from two or more races. [[Hispanic (U.S. Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Latino (U.S. Census)|Latino]] of any race were 0.31% of the population. There were 1,105 households out of which 25.2% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 57.4% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 7.9% had a female householder with no husband present, and 32.2% were non-families. 29.7% of all households were made up of individuals and 15.0% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.30 and the average family size was 2.85. In the borough the population was spread out with 21.1% under the age of 18, 5.8% from 18 to 24, 24.1% from 25 to 44, 26.2% from 45 to 64, and 22.8% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 44 years. For every 100 females there were 87.0 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 84.5 males. The median income for a household in the borough was $33,646, and the median income for a family was $47,049. Males had a median income of $32,478 versus $22,134 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the borough was $21,002. About 4.0% of families and 6.5% of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 5.3% of those under age 18 and 8.6% of those age 65 or over. ==References== <references /> ==External links== * [http://www.geistownborough.com Official Borough Web Page] {{Cambria County, Pennsylvania}} [[Category:Populated places established in 1812]] [[Category:Boroughs in Cambria County, Pennsylvania]]
